title: Decompile or analyse injected /usr/bin/cat
content:
I'm trying to decompile or analyse an injected Linux executable binary file /usr/bin/cat ,and find the injected code as a readable.

Need some tips as a beginner how to find the injection method if it's the right start.

comments.text: Do you have access to the original binary e.g. from your Linux distribution, to compare it to? Iâ€™d also guess you could get Ghidra or similar to just decompile everything and find the code in there.
